com.launchdarkly.testhelpers.httptest

Interface SpecialHttpConfigurations.TestAction

  • Enclosing class:
    SpecialHttpConfigurations

    public static interface SpecialHttpConfigurations.TestAction
    Implemented by the caller to perform some action against an HTTP server.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean doTest(java.net.URI targetUri, SpecialHttpConfigurations.Params params)
      Implement this method to perform whatever kind of HTTP client action you are testing.

    • Method Detail

      • doTest

        boolean doTest(java.net.URI targetUri,
               SpecialHttpConfigurations.Params params)
        throws java.io.IOException,
               SpecialHttpConfigurations.UnexpectedResponseException
        Implement this method to perform whatever kind of HTTP client action you are testing. The test framework has already set up a server with some predefined configuration, and has provided the base URI of that server in targetUri. The properties in params indicate how you should customize your HTTP client. The goal is to verify that 1. these features (such as TLS and proxy configuration) work correctly in the client and 2. your configuration logic is accurately transferring these parameters to the client.
        Parameters:
        targetUri - the URI to query
        params - client configuration options
        Returns:
        true if successful; false if your client implementation does not support some of those parameters and you are deliberately skipping this test
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the connection failed
        SpecialHttpConfigurations.UnexpectedResponseException - if you were able to connect and send the request, but the content of the response was not consistent with the handler you passed to the test method
